intro: Piptocarpha umbellulata, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating remarkable adaptability to drought conditions. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Piptocarpha umbellulata plays a vital role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
